newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-NZ airline passengers offered alternative flights.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-NZ airline passengers offered alternative flights.

text.p: Stranded passengers from New Zealand airline Kiwi International are being offered alternative travel from Brisbane to their destinations aboard other Kiwi International flights, an airline spokesman said on Monday.
"The airline has other aircraft flying and urges the 300 passengers to talk to Kiwi International about alternative flight arrangements," the spokesman told Reuters.
A dispute which grounded the Kiwi International A320 Airbus at Brisbane at the weekend was currently being heard in the Brisbane Supreme Court, he said.
The dispute between Kiwi and the aircraft's lessor, Singapore company Region Air, was related to "commercial matters," the spokesman said.
The aircraft's lease had been pre-paid to the end of September with the airline seeking clarifications on some details in the lease, he said.
Kiwi International currently has a Boeing 737 aircraft available to fly passengers to their destinations, he said.
